data.prayer: Spirit, encourage every believer in Pampanga, Philippines to do the work of an evangelist with their friends and neighbors.
data.verse: But you, keep your head in all situations, endure hardship, do the work of an evangelist

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Pampanga, Philippines
data.section_summary: What people or resources could you pray for in this photo?

data.prayer: Father, guide the church in Pampanga, Philippines to see their community as a holy priesthood, offering spiritual sacrifices acceptable to God.
data.verse: you also, like living stones, are being built into a spiritual house to be a holy priesthood, offering spiritual sacrifices acceptable to God through Jesus Christ.

data.prayer: Good Shepherd, thank you that you know the name of each of the 306,205 believers in Pampanga.
data.verse: I am the good shepherd; I know my sheep and my sheep know me

data.prayer: Father, thank you that you will never abandon the church of Pampanga, Philippines.
data.verse: Be free from the love of money, content with such things as you have, for he has said, “I will in no way leave you, neither will I in any way forsake you.

data.prayer: Lord, remember the Kalagan people. Make the Kalagan people a chosen race, a royal priesthood, a holy nation, a people for your own possession.
Jesus, call those who are far off in Pampanga, Philippines, so that they and their family can receive life.
data.verse: For the promise is to you, and to your children, and to all who are far off, even as many as the Lord our God will call to himself.

data.prayer: Spirit, build the strength and maturity of the local leaders in Pampanga, Philippines. Show them that faithfulness is more important than knowledge. Show them that the Spirit, the Word, and prayer is enough in order to grow and lead.
Jesus, make the 1,693,394 people in the state of Pampanga who claim to know you, brave enough to let the Bible weigh their thoughts and intentions today.
data.verse: For the word of God is living and powerful, and sharper than any two-edged sword, piercing even to the division of soul and spirit, and of joints and marrow, and is a discerner of the thoughts and intents of the heart.
